subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Practice 4 — Strengthening of elbows (Kehuni Sakti Vikasaka) Practice 5 — Strengthening of the shoulder joint (Skandha Chakra)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: GENERAL GUIDELINES FOR CONDUCTING ABOVE PRACTICES STEPWISE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The instructions provided below outline the steps for all the Sukshma Vyayama Practices. These same steps should be followed for all other practices as well.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Physcial Education 7 - Unit 6.indd 167

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Sukshma Vyayama for strengthening of the fingers: (Anguli Sakti Vikasaka)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Sthiti: Vajrasana or Sukhasana Step 1: Raise both hands in front of the body at shoulder level. Step 2: While inhaling, stretch your fingers.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 3: While exhaling, compress your fingers and form a fist with the thumb inside. This completes one round. (Repeat the practice 10 times).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 4: After completing the practice, place your hands on your thighs and relax in Vajrasana.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: « Encourage the students to do the practice with awareness and correct breathing patterns.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Once students master these practices, other variations can be introduced.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Refer Grade 4 and Grade 6 textbook for more Sukshma Vyayama practices.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SITHALIKARANA VYAYAMA

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Sithalikarana Vyayama refers to a set of loosening exercises that prepare the body by building a solid foundation through increased flexibility, endurance and strength for intense Yoga practices. These exercises are designed to Warm-up the body and improve spinal flexibility by repeatedly stretching and relaxing different muscle groups. They also enhance joint mobility and circulation. Sithalikarana Vyayama is often practiced at the beginning of a Yoga session to ensure that the spine and large muscles are adequately prepared for dsanas.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade, let us learn the following loosening practices:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Bending forward, backward and sideways: Improves mobility and flexibility of the spine region. 2. Spinal twists: Gentle twists to stretch and relax the spine.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SURYA NAMASKARA

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade, let us learn how to stretch, strengthen and rejuvenate our body and mind through the practice of Surya Namaskara.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The Sun is important for life on Earth. It provides us with light and warmth, which are essential for plants to grow and for us to live. It is also a major source of Vitamin D, which helps our bodies stay strong and healthy. In many cultures, the Sun is seen as a symbol of power and knowledge. We can show our gratitude for the Sun by appreciating its life-giving energy and respecting its power.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Surya Namaskara, is a series of Yoga poses performed in a sequence. It's a great way to greet the sun and start the day with positivity. Sirya Namaskara combines Asana, Pranadyam and mantras. It's a complete workout for both body and mind. It also serves as an excellent warm-up for advanced Yoga practices or as a standalone routine for overall health and well-being.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Benefits of Surya Namaskara

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Strengthens muscles, improves flexibility and enhances cardiovascular health.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Stimulates digestion and metabolism. Engages various muscle groups, building strength in arms, legs, core and back.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 4. Boosts endurance and stamina, beneficial for athletes and overall fitness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 5. Aidsinthesmooth transition from childhood to adolescence by influencing hormones.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 6. Combined with mindful breathing, reduces stress and anxiety, promoting mental clarity and focus.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 7. Enhances mood and reduces feelings of depression.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 8. Aids in anger management, boosts self-esteem and supports academic achievement.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: LIMITATIONS:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Students with certain serious or chronic physical conditions, heart issues or fatigue should avoid the practice.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Asana

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Asana is the third limb of Ashtanga Yoga. The word dsana means comfortable posture. In Yoga, dsana are specific body postures designed to improve strength, flexibility and balance. Asana are not just exercises, they are a part of a holistic lifestyle. Practicing Yoga postures regularly can have a positive impact on your physical and mental well-being.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga believes that there are countless Yoga poses, as many as there are living beings in the world! These poses often resemble animals like snakes, birds, and fish, or plants like trees and lotuses.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Hatha Yoga, a popular type of Yoga, focuses on physical postures. It highlights 32 special poses that are believed to improve balance, help your body's energy flow smoothly and keep you

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: healthy.

text: Relaxation is essential after the practice Sy session to regain and rejuvenate the body AS» and the mind. Relaxation techniques

text: Before practicing Pranayama it is essential to normalize breathing patterns. To make breathing uniform, continuous and rhythmic, full utilisation of the lungs are necessary. Breathing practices develop awareness on breathing while practising Yoga.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade let us learn about Marjaridsana and Vyagrahasana with breathing techniques. These dsanas are so called because they emulate the spinal stretching movements made by cats and tigers.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 5: Come to the initial posture after the practice.

text: Chapter 4

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Pranayama

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade let us learn more about breathing through the fourth aspect of Ashtanga Yoga which is Pranayama.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Pranayama is the practice of controlling our breath. In Yoga, our breath is considered a powerful tool. Breathing techniques that promote our life force are Pranayama. The word Pranayama comes from two words: ‘Prana’ means ‘vital energy’ and ‘Yama’ means ‘to control or extend’. So, Pranayama is the way by which we consciously control and direct our breath to make ourselves happier and healthier.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Why is Pranayama Important for students?

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Just like we need healthy food to stay physically fit, likewise to keep the body energised and calm the mind, we need to do Pranayama practices. It’s especially helpful for students because it helps with focus during studies, staying calm during exams, and even feeling more energised for sports or daily activities.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Improves our

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: concentration | Feeling more Benefits of Reduces energised Pranayama stress

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Try practicing Pranayama for a few minutes every morning. You will feel ready to take on your day with more energy and less stress.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade let us practice what we had learnt in the previous grade like

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Sectional Breathing

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Sectional breathing is a preparatory breathing practice for Pranayama. It corrects the wrong breathing pattern and increases the vital capacity of the lungs.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 2. Nadisuddhi Pranayama Nadisuddhi Pranayama is a simple and powerful technique that

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: balances the flow of Prana (life force) and cleans the subtle energy channels.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 3. Bhramarit Pranayama

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Bhramart Pranayama is a calming technique, which has a soothing effect on the mind and nervous system.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: (Refer to Khel Yatra Grade 6 textbook for the above practices).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Let us learn how to perform Bhramari Pranayama by adopting Shanmukhi Mudra:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Shanmukhi means six gates or faces. Shanmukhi mudra_ involves redirecting the awareness inside by closing the six doors of outer perception, the two eyes, the two ears, the nose and the mouth. This practice promotes a state of Pratyahara. In other words, it closes the six gates of perception in the head with the fingers of both hands.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Physcial Education 7 - Unit 6.indd 197

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Sit in Sukhdsana with the spine erect, face smiling and eyes gently closed.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Nowraise both the arms to shoulder level, bend your elbows and close the ears with the thumb.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Place the index finger gently on the eyelids, middle finger on both the nostrils and ring and small finger above and below the lips as shown in the picture.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Inhale slowly and deeply and fill the lungs completely.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e As you exhale, make a steady, low-pitched humming sound like a bee. (Makara sound from Omkara chanting)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Feel the vibration of the sound resonate throughout your head and body. Repeat the practice five times.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: BENEFITS OF SHANMUKHI MUDRA

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Shanmukhi Mudra calms the mind and nervous system. * It also balances internal and external awareness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ It also enhances focus and helps in managing anxiety. Note for the teacher

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: « Ask the students whether they could feel the resonance during the practice. * Ask about their state of mind after the practice.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade let us learn about Bhastrika Pranayama stepwise.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Bhastrika Pranayama

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Bhastrika is a special breathing exercise that gets its name from ‘bellows’, because it's like breathing in and out like a bellows. You can do it slowly or quickly, whichever feels comfortable.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: During Bhastrika, you breathe deeply and fully, so your body gets lots of oxygen. You use your chest like a bellows to breathe in and out strongly.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: There are two parts to Bhastrika — the first part is like a cleansing breath, and the second part is slower and calmer. That’s why Bhastrika is sometimes called a bridge between cleansing breaths and calmer breathing exercises.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Stepwise practice of Bhastrika Pranayama

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 1: It ina comfortable posture Sukhasana or Vajrasana. Keep the head and spine i) straight, and close the eyes and relax the whole body.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 2: Take a deep breath through both nostrils and fill the lungs with air.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 3: After full inhalation, quickly exhale continuously for 5 times. This completes one round of Bhastrika.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 4: Continue this practice for 3 rounds.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SE BENEFITS

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Bhastrika Pranayama strengthens the lungs and improves blood circulation.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ It relaxes the body and mind and improves concentration.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ‘Limitations: The students with the low stamina should avoid this: practice. \

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher ¢ Ensure the students gently practice this Pranayama without any jerks.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga 199

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: MUDRAS INTRODUCTION TO HAND MUDRAS

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Let us explore hand mudras! Have you ever seen pictures of saints or gods with their hands in special positions? These are called hand mudras.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Mudras are hand gestures that help connect our body, mind and energy. The word ‘mudra’ means ‘gesture’ or ‘seal’ in Sanskrit. They are like special hand signals that can help our energy flow freely.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: People have been using mudras for a very long

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: time to feel better physically and mentally.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade let us learn about Jnana mudra.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Jnana Mudra is an important and simple mudra which calms the mind.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: STEPWISE PRACTICE OF JNANA MUDRA

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Sit in a comfortable posture Sukhasana or Vajrasana or on a chair with the back straight.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Place your hands on thighs with your palm facing upward.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Now gently touch the tip of the thumb with the tip of the index finger. Do not press hard.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 4. Stretch the other finger straight, let the palm be facing upward.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 5. Keep the focus on your breath.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 6. Practice it for 10 minutes every day.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: BENEFITS

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Jnana Mudra reduces mental tension, anger and stress. * It increases memory power.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ It gives energy to the brain and muscles.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: We also learnt Shanmukhi Mudra with Bhramart Pranayama in the previous chapter.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher * Encourage students to practice this mudras everyday especially before studies.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Pratyahara

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Hello students, Have you heard of Pratyahara?

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Pratyahara is a special tool which helps us to focus. It is a cool way to develop our concentration and remain calm.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Pratyahara is the 5th step of Ashtanga Yoga, which teaches us how to concentrate deeper and stronger.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: So, in this grade let us learn how to reduce distraction by doing the below activity.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Activity to develop focus by engaging your ear to the sound

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: of a bell

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Let us listen to the sound of a temple bell. Listen closely as it starts with a strong ‘bong!’ and then continues to ring. Notice how the ringing changes — it might be loud at first and then become softer and softer until it finally disappears. Try to feel the vibrations of the sound within you.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Physcial Education 7 - Unit 6.indd 201

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Dharana, Dhyana and Samadhi

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Dharana means single point concentration and involves keeping the mind study and focus.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Dharana is like learning to use a focus for your mind. It is about training your mind to pay attention to just one thing, like focusing sunlight with a magnifying glass.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: better, concentrate on tasks and mangae your

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: wT

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: When your mind is focused, it helps you study b

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: thoughts. You can practice Dharana by choosing something to focus on, like your breath or a word, and trying to keep your mind from wandering. This skill, along with Dhyana, helps you find inner peace and is an important part of Yoga.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In the previous grade, we learnt about jatru trataka, which improves our focus. Let us continue the practice in this grade.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Let us practice Dharana by focusing on a single point. Jatru Trataka is yogic gazing that helps to bring one pointed concentration or focus. It is a practice where the gaze is fixed on an object or the target. Before starting it is a good idea to cleanse your eyes with cold water.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: i f) f fl f} fl f) f.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ee ee ee ee S| So S| ee | | ee Cleansing of eyes using the palms:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Wash your hands with soap thoroughly. Make a cup of your right palm and fill it with clean water. Now, immerse your right eyeball in this water. Blink the eyes for few rounds. Repeat the same practice with the left eye.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: jJatru trataka

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 1: Sit in Vajrasana or Sukhadsana comfortably. Keep your eyes open and hands on the thighs.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 2: Now stretch both the hands in front, make fists out of them while the thumbs raised upwards.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 3: Move both the hands towards both the shoulders parallel to the ground and keep gazing at the tip of the thumbs. Stretch the hands sideways as far as possible until the reach of the vision.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 4: Maintain this position for a while by holding the hands at both the ends. Slowly move the hands back to the original position while gazing at the tip of the thumbs. Do not move the head but move only the eyeballs sideways.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Repeat this practice for 3-5 rounds.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step 5: After the practice do simple palming and relax in Vajrasana or Sukhasana.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga 203

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Simple palming procedure

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Rub both palms until they become warm.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Cup your palms and place them gently over the eyes (do not put pressure on the eyeballs).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep your eyes closed.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep your palms on your eyes for 10-15 seconds, then gently lift them.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Sideways viewing of Jatru trataka relaxes the muscles around the eyes.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: « It also prevents and corrects squint. « It also improves eyesight, vision and concentration.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ‘Limitations: Students with severe headaches should avoid this. practice.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Ensure that students remove their glasses and wrist watches.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Encourage them to sit with the head, neck and spine erect during the practice. * Always open your eyes with a few blinks.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Ensure palming is done after each practice.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: For up and down and right and left movement of the Jatru trataka refer to the Khel Yatra Grade 6 textbook.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: DHYANA

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Dhyana means meditation. When we focus really hard on one thing (this is called Dharana), our mind starts to calm down. This calmness and stillness is Dhyana.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Dhyana helps us feel peaceful inside, even when things around us are noisy or chaotic. Imagine training your mind to focus on one thing like a laser beam that’s Dharana.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Both Dharana and Dhyana can help you focus better in school, stay calm during exams, and feel more peaceful in your everyday life.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Activity Simple Meditation Exercise

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Now let us learn simple meditation technique step by step.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Sit in a comfortable posture Sukhdsana or Vajrasana with spine erect and eyes closed.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Now slowly move your awareness on your breath. Observe your breathing for a few seconds as you breathe in and breath out.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ If thoughts come into your mind, don’t worry. Just gently bring your attention back to your breath.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Practice this for a few minutes. This is Dhyana, where you focus on your breath and let your mind become calm and peaceful.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PANCHAKOSHA MEDITATION

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Just like a house has different rooms like the living room, kitchen, and bedroom, our bodies also have different layers. We learned about these layers in Chapter 1.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: In this grade, let's go on an inner journey to explore these layers

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: within ourselves through meditation. This inner journey will help us understand ourselves better and feel more peaceful and happy.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Step-by-step practice of Panchakosha meditation

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Sit comfortably in Sukhasana with the head, neck and spine in a straight line. Keep the body relaxed.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 2. Now gently close your eyes, become aware of your surroundings and sounds around you. Begin by gently scanning your body, be aware of your head, shoulders, chest, waist, back, abdomen, arms and legs notice any sensation or any areas of tension. Acknowledge these sensations without judgement. This is your Annamaya kosha, the physical body. Observe it for a few seconds and relax the physical body.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 3. Now shift your focus to your breath. Bring your awareness between your nostrils and observe the air entering the nostrils as you breathe in and breathe out. Observe your breathing slows down andis more continuous and rhythmic. Be aware of the breath as your lungs expands and contracts. This is your Pranamaya kosha. Observe for a few seconds and enjoy the lightness of the body.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 4. Now observe the thoughts that arise in your mind. Notice how they come and go like clouds in the sky. Simply acknowledge them and gently bring your attention back to your breath. Now shift your awareness and become aware of the sensation in your body. You might start feeling uncomfortable sitting in one position for a long time and want to move your legs or you might experience some kind of itching sensation on your skin, nose, etc., This is a reflexive mental chatter that comes from your mind. This is your Manomaya Kosha.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 5. Trynottorespond to it, but continue to observe your breath. Connect with your inner wisdom and ask yourself

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: “What brings me joy”. Gently listen to the inner guidance that arises. This is your Vijinanamaya Kosha.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 6. Now shift your awareness deep in sight. Now centre your awareness to your heart, relax deeply, Keep breathing smoothly and evenly. Now allow yourself to settle in a state of complete tranquility. Enjoy the sense of great joy and gratitude within you. It is a space of perfect stillness, silence and happiness. There is no fear or desire. This is your Anandamaya Kosha. Now simply be aware of your own awareness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 7. Return your awareness to your breath, become aware of your surroundings. Observe that your breathing is slow and continuous. Take a moment to relax and absorb this experience before you get up.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 8. Now gently rub your palms, place it on your eyes and open your eyes into your palms.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Panchakosha meditation calms the mind and reduces stress. ¢ It improves focus and self-awareness. ¢ It brings peace and happiness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher ¢ Encourage students to share their experiences with meditation.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Let students focus on breath, observe their thoughts and feelings during the practice.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Physcial Education 7 - Unit 6.indd 207

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SAMADHI

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Samadhi is the ultimate state of consciousness. It is a transcending thought. You are only aware of yourself and are connected to your true nature love, joy and strength. This is the ultimate goal that we seek to achieve in life.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Krida Yoga

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga is a process for all round personality development. Krida yoga plays an important part in this process. Krida yoga means yoga through games. It is a fun and active way to practise yoga through different kinds ofplayful activities. Krida yoga combines yoga movements with games to help you build flexibility, strength and focus while having fun with your classmates.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: These games are easy to learn and play and ensure total participation. These games not only give us an insight into our state of awareness but also help us to develop it.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Here are a few games which you can play with your friends in the class or with members of your family.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga of Reflection

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Yoga of reflection is an indoor game, normally played in groups. This game develops focus and mindfulness by copying the movements of the opponents. This game also improves concentration, body awareness and coordination.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: How TO PLAY 1. Divide the class into two groups,

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 2. Let the students pair up and face each other.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 3. One student leads and performs a Yoga pose or movement slowly, while the other student tries to mirror their movements exactly.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 4. Each student maintains the pose for 1 minute. Then, the other student mirrors the pose for 1 minute.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Note for the teacher

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ The game is to be played for a maximum of 5 minutes.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: « Variations are encouraged to make the game interesting.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: « Ensure all students participate in the game.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Please explain the following takeaways and learnings to the students.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: LEARNINGS FROM THIS GAME Promotes active engagement and focus Promotes physical and mental stability Encourages body awareness Improves communication skills Strengthens trust and cooperation Promotes patience and resilience

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Purpose The T-Test measures agility, speed, and body control, which are important for sports and overall fitness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: EQUIPMENT NEEDED

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Four cones or markers

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Astopwatch

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e A flat surface (like a gym floor or open field)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SETUP

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Place the cones in a T-shape as follows: * Cone A (starting line) * Cone B (10 meters straight ahead of A) * Cone C (5 meters to the left of B)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Cone D (5 meters to the right of B)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Eat UT i]

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra ——————————

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Start at Cone A in a ready position. Sprint forward to Cone B and touch it with your right hand.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Side-shuffle left to Cone C and touch it with your left hand.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. 2. 3. 4. Side-shuffle right to Cone D and touch it with your right hand. 5. Side-shuffle back to Cone B and touch it again.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 6. Run backward to Cone A as fast as possible.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 7. Stop the timer when the participant crosses Cone A.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SCORING

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Record the time (in seconds) taken to complete the test. e Faster times indicate better agility.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep feet parallel during side shuffles.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Ensure proper hand touches at each cone.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Perform 3 trials and take the best time. Cardiovascular Endurance

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: METER RUN/WALK TEST

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The 600-Meter Run/Walk Test measures cardiovascular endurance and

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: assesses how well a person can sustain moderate to high-intensity activity over a short distance.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: EQUIPMENT NEEDED ¢ Stopwatch

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Measuring tape (if the track is not pre-marked)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Flat running surface (track or open field)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Cones or markers (to indicate start and finish points)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: avn il

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE Warm-up: Perform 5-10 minutes of light jogging and stretching. Starting Position: Stand behind the start line in a ready position.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Go! Start running or walking as fast as possible when the instructor gives the signal.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Maintain a steady pace and try to complete the 600 meters without stopping.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Finish Line: Stop the timer as soon as the participant crosses the finish line.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 6. Record the total time taken to complete the 600 meters.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SCORING

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ The time is recorded in minutes and seconds.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Faster times indicate better endurance.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Compare improvement over time instead of using fixed benchmarks. GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Encourage steady pacing—don’t sprint too fast at the start.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Use the same track and conditions for retests to ensure consistency.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 3-Minute Step Test

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PURPOSE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The 3-Minute Step Test measures cardiovascular endurance by evaluating

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: how quickly the heart recovers after exercise.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: EQUIPMENT NEEDED

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: A 12-inch (30 cm) step or bench Stopwatch Metronome or music with a 96 beats-per-minute (bpm) rhythm

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Heart rate monitor (optional) or manual pulse counting

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Warm-up: Perform light stretching and jogging for 5 minutes. Step Pattern:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Step up with one foot.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Step up with the other foot.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Step down with one foot.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Step down with the other foot.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Maintain a steady up-up-down-down rhythm. Step to the Beat:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ The pace should be 96 steps per minute (24 complete steps per minute).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Continue stepping for 3 minutes without stopping.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: After 3 Minutes: ¢ Sit down immediately. ¢ Wait 5 seconds, then measure your pulse for 1 full minute.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Count beats at the wrist (radial artery) or neck (carotid artery). Record your heart rate (beats per minute).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: avn il

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: SCORING ¢ Lower heart rates indicate better cardiovascular fitness.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Compare results with previous tests to track improvement.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Usea consistent stepping speed.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ No extra movements—keep the upper body relaxed. e Use the same step height for all tests.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Ensure proper posture and breathing throughout.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Strength & Muscular Endurance PusH-UPs TEST (MAXIMUM REPs IN 1 MINUTE)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PURPOSE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The Push-Up Test measures upper body strength and endurance, focusing on the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: EQUIPMENT NEEDED

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Flat surface (gym floor or mat for comfort)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Stopwatch ¢ Partner or instructor to count reps and check form

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Starting Position: ¢ Place hands shoulder-width apart on the floor. ¢ Keep your body straight from head to heels. ¢ Feet should be together or slightly apart.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 2. Performing the Push-Up:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Lower your chest until it’s about 90 degrees at the elbows or until it nearly touches the ground.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Push back up to full arm extension.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep a steady pace—no stopping! 3. Counting Reps:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Only correct form counts.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Ifthe body sags or hips rise too much, that rep does not count. 4. Test Duration:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Perform as many push-ups as possible in 1 minute. SCORING

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Record the total number of correct push-ups.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Compare results over time to track improvement. GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: No faulty movements—only full push-ups count! Keep body straight (avoid sagging or bending knees).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Use the same testing method for all students (standard push-up or modified knee push-up for those who need it).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Squat Test (Maximum Reps in 1 Minute) PURPOSE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The Squat Test measures lower body strength and endurance, targeting the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and core.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: EQUIPMENT NEEDED

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Flat surface (gym floor or mat for comfort) ¢ Stopwatch

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Partner or instructor to count reps and check form

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: avn il

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Starting Position:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Stand with feet shoulder- width apart.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Keep your chest up and back straight.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Hands can be on hips or extended forward for balance.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Performing the Squat:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Lower your body until thighs are parallel to the ground (90-degree angle at knees).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep knees aligned with toes (avoid knees collapsing inward). ¢ Push back up to the starting position. ¢ Maintain a steady rhythm—no pausing! Counting Reps: * Only correct squats count. ¢ If depth is too shallow or form is incorrect, the rep does not count. Test Duration: ¢ Perform as many squats as possible in 1 minute. SCORING ¢ Record the total number of correct squats.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Compare results over time to track improvement.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Keep heels on the ground—no tiptoeing.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ No bouncing or half-squats—thighs must reach parallel.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Use the same testing conditions for consistent results.

text: SIT-AND-REACH TEST (FLEXIBILITY MEASUREMENT)

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: The Sit-and-Reach Test measures hamstring and lower back flexibility. Good flexibility in these areas helps with posture, injury prevention, and overall

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: mobility.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Flexibility — a

text: PURPOSE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: e Sit-and-reach box (or a ruler/tape measure placed on the floor) ¢ Flat, non-slippery surface

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: PROCEDURE

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 1. Starting Position: e Sit on the floor with legs fully extended and feet flat against the box (or with heels 12 inches apart if using a ruler).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: po e Keep knees straight and feet flexed (toes pointing upward).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Khel Yatra —

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 2. Performing the Test:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: ¢ Reach forward slowly and steadily with both hands.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Keep hands one on top of the other and palms facing downward. Hold the stretch for at least 2 seconds at the farthest point.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: No bouncing or jerky movements—it must be a smooth reach. 3. Measuring the Reach:

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Measure the distance from the starting point (toes = 0 inches) to the farthest reach.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: If the fingertips do not reach the toes, record a negative score (e.g., -3 inches).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: If the fingertips go beyond the toes, record a positive score (e.g., +4 inches).

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: 4. Best of Three Attempts: ¢ Perform three trials and record the best score.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: GUIDELINES FOR ACCURACY

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: No bending knees—they must stay straight throughout. e Ensure a smooth reach—no bouncing.

subject: PHYSICAL_EDUCATION
text: Use the same testing method for accurate comparison over time. Speed
